name: Overview

[{"id":"398b7359-d916-4780-aa0e-5ecb20893774","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":1,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Group: Control Flow & Error Handling","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8baaab0f-a54f-4f66-9610-6096b388f486","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description:
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"These methods handle the logic that dictates the execution path of the program. This includes conditional branching, looping mechanisms, context managers, and exception handling blocks.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d48cc446-4076-4222-945a-ee9f7b1aae9b","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Static analysis of control flow is critical because the "state" of a variable often depends on which path the code takes. For example, a variable might be an integer in the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"if","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" block but a string in the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"else","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" block. This group of methods is responsible for simulating these divergent paths and then merging the results back together to form a coherent view of the program's potential states.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"a4c621d7-a1c8-4c67-8c3b-770aa7d477fe","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"1e12af73-2df8-4c9d-9763-93c83764cc85","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":2,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Function Descriptions","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"75fce6ef-a327-4201-ac3d-73a53a2f2755","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"visit_If","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"eeb9af13-a26c-47ef-aaae-4df74b819f2a","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description:
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Analyzes conditional branches in the code (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"if","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"elif","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"else","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"). It manages the complex task of branching the analysis state and then merging conflicting variable definitions from different paths.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"0ea67e3f-28ad-4649-aeb3-e43a2a8b0d54","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Internal Logic:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4264a327-265c-46ac-a89f-89a07dc25878","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Branching:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It effectively "splits" the analysis. It enters the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"if","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" block, records changes to variables, and then separately enters the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"else","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" block (if present) and records changes there.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1f4448b0-841d-4f2c-aae2-14efca3cf057","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"State Merging (","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"mergeIfElse","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"):","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" After processing both blocks, it calls a helper function to reconcile the differences. If variable ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"x","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is assigned ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"5","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"if","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"10","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"else","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the analyzer records that ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"x","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" can be ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"{5, 10}","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" after the block.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"71944d12-5cc7-4ed3-a2ed-327694d4c4bb","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Main Guard Detection:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It specifically checks for the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"if __name__ == "__main__":","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" idiom to avoid analyzing script-execution code as part of the module's importable definition.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c60a53c9-7a00-40b1-a3e5-a123d5247c08","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"visit_While","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"fa8b7cd5-9014-4d2a-a4d6-a77236d1854d","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description:
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Processes ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"while","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" loops.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d821b3f4-afc5-4e51-8d17-564c2a371be6","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Internal Logic:
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"It treats ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"while","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" loops similarly to ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"if","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" statements but implies repetition. In this implementation, it delegates heavily to ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"visit_If","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" logic, creating a scope and analyzing the body. It assumes the body ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"might","styles":{"italic":true}},{"type":"text","text":" execute, ensuring variables defined inside are registered in the scope.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"072ed95d-c92b-4542-a89d-0eb0ccf02de8","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"visit_For","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"dfb93dcc-e0ba-417d-827f-34a7fe923bba","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description:
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Processes ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"for","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" loops, which are distinct because they involve assignment (the iterator variable).","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1873845e-200c-4d0f-8cf4-b78a4a2b0c73","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Internal Logic:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"a9fb7776-2981-46d5-9a5b-a525bface7e5","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Iterator Assignment:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It analyzes the object being iterated over (the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"iter","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" node). It resolves what is inside that object (e.g., if iterating over a list of strings, the loop variable is a string).","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"48ba3425-767e-49b5-a776-c187da79e6e9","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Protocol Resolution:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It simulates the Python iterator protocol, looking for ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"__iter__","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"__next__","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" methods to determine exactly what values are yielded to the loop variable.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6193ce97-bf9e-4c5b-a167-8dc1167c744d","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Target Updating:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It updates the loop variable (the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"i","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"for i in items","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") with these resolved values in the current scope.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"66c3bd23-2754-4698-bbca-c1c6301203a0","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"visit_With","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"5568a256-dec7-471c-9f9f-6fa29cc6bbbc","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description:
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Processes context managers (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"with open(...) as f:","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"396d0841-ebe2-4442-9d42-d7f9bebff34e","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Internal Logic:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e11b6173-7fa3-484a-95f4-78d962628854","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Protocol simulation:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It simulates the context manager protocol by resolving and "calling" the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"__enter__","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"__exit__","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" methods of the context object.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"5d2c7519-10a3-47b1-bc48-01bcd0dc85ac","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Variable Binding:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" If there is an ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"as var","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" clause, it assigns the return value of ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"__enter__","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to that variable in the current scope.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"73ae5c90-fbc3-4c84-b047-b9de623e9128","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Scope Management:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It creates a temporary scope for the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"with","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" block to track variables defined specifically within that context.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d2bfbd3f-1bf8-41a1-8dde-0c66046b8839","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"visit_Try / visit_ExceptHandler / visit_Raise","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4199b4ef-457d-4316-9459-045de850ca9e","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description:
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"These methods collectively handle Python's error handling mechanisms.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"904ae827-f0fc-47f8-8187-cdc1dc09deee","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Internal Logic:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f665ec52-35e5-408f-83d8-9cc26bb49259","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"visit_Try","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":":","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Orchestrates the flow. It visits the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"try","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" block first. Then, it visits all ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"except","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" handlers. This ensures that the analyzer sees definitions that occur in the happy path ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"and","styles":{"italic":true}},{"type":"text","text":" definitions that occur during error handling.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"bc46eaab-eefe-4c01-af5b-0c40d8344c9a","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"visit_ExceptHandler","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":":","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Analyzes the code inside an ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"except","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" block. It ensures that any variables defined here are merged into the scope, acknowledging that the program might crash into this block.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4b947b6b-630c-478e-90d7-c77515050b4d","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"visit_Raise","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":":","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Analyzes ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"raise","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" statements. It resolves the exception object being raised. If the exception is a custom class, it may trace dependencies (via ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"cg.add_edge","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") to ensure the relationship between the raiser and the exception class is known.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d2369c2a-77c8-4e31-b9de-d599d67ab15d","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
